name: Hilton San Diego Bayfront

reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful; one of the nicest Hiltons I have had the pleasure to stay in. I did feel a little removed from the Gaslamp Quarter, but that was remedied with a quick walk past the convention center; taking the pedestrian bridge seemed less direct to access the restaurants and other interests on 5th Avenue. The staff I encountered were polite and unlike most other hotels, their demeanor seemed genuine. For convention center attendees, the location cannot be beat.
reviews.title: Its own little island
Very enjoyable but a little impersonal at times
reviews.text: I stayed here for a week at a conference 15 21 Sept 2012. First, it has a great location and if you get a bay view window high up the view is second to none. The rooms are spacious and well appointed and the showers (usually a downfall) are very good. Inside the hotel there are a couple of bars, Odysea on the reception level, good but gets very crowded and service can be slow - it is also a little pricey. The Fox Grill on the lower level is a typical sports bar with wall to wall Baseball or American Football but the food is good and there is a decent range of beers. There is the ubiquitous Starbucks outside the front with the usual queues at coffee time. Downstairs is the Vale restaurant, good but very expensive for what it is.

Would I recommend it, yes, it is close to the Gaslamp area and there is a great walk along the bay front to a reasonable touristy shopping area, there are good local restaurants and the hotel is comfortable. The only downside is the reception. Here you can wait for ages as there never seems to be enough staff on and several walk by, chat to those working and disappear through the door behind the desk never to be seen again; after a very long flight you just want to get through and settled. Having said that don't let it detract from what was a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Yes but...
Location is Awesome
reviews.text: Beautiful settings overlooking the bay with great view almost from every room. Excellent location in front of the Convention center and walking distance to Gaslamp District. Service however is inexistent. No personal touch whatsoever. Personnel does not pay attention to details (newspaper, bottled water, etc.) Breakfast buffet is expensive for what it is with poor choice of food. Fruits are not even fresh. So unless you have nowhere else to go, skip this hotel.

The location of this hotel is so great. They are right next to the water. Sweet Things Yogurt is at the hotel and they have treats for breakfast as well as yogurt with amazing toppings for after lunch. Sweet Things also has a reward card on the PerkCounter App to Buy 8 Yogurts and Get 1 Free. It's nice to get free stuff while traveling with the family so I thought I'd add that little tip.
reviews.title: Worth the rates
Wow great experience
reviews.text: From the moment we drove our rental to valet parking, where we got a cheerful greeting from Todd, to check-in @ 10:00, where we were whisked to a corner room with a view of Mission Bay, the stay was perfect. Pedro, Assistant Front Desk Manager even escorted my Dear Wife to the Women's Room, as she was confused where it was. Absolutely impeccable guest services, & one of our best stays ANYWHERE.

There is absolutely nothing wrong with the San Diego Bayfront Hilton and there is much to like. The rooms are standard but comfortable. The shower is very nice. Location is always the key to business hotels and this hotel has a great view overlooking the harbor. But it is really only convenient to the Convention Center and baseball stadium. The little things that were slightly troubling are: weird access on the ground floor. The main lobby is one level above but the ground level has 2 distinct entrances, neither of which is very grand. I could not figure out where breakfast was served (or was up too early for it). One of the most impressive things was the level of service of the staff. When I arrived, the wifi was broken in my room, but eventually it was repaired and worked well. This kind of problem is often bounced around to different people, but it eventually came to be fixed.
reviews.title: Top drawer business hotel

reviews.text: Just checked out from a 6 night stay. We had a 2 queen with bay/city view on the 24th floor. They didn't recognize I was gold until I asked about breakfast so this wasn't an upgrade.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Nice and great location, but expensive details

reviews.text: Fantastic views
reviews.title: Nice hotel, no fridge
The Hilton was nice and I will return
reviews.text: Went there on business and really enjoyed it. Great views and just across the street from downtown San Diego.
Beautiful scenery and views, great location, top-notch rooms with great bedding and high end toiletries, a helpful friendly staff, and many more positives made this a enjoyable place to stay.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in San Diego

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used our HiltonHonors coupons for the $10 (regular price about $22) breakfast buffet (instead of the Starbucks options) and did not realize until checkout that we had coupons for an appetizer at the hotel bar Odysea (would have been nice it that was mentioned to us at check in). It would have been even better if they had a HiltonHonors concierge floor and lounge. Regardless, I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of June. Hotel is very conveniently located next to the convention center and has a new pedestrian bridge over to the Gas lamp area, and Petco park. We found the hotel staff to be quite friendly and helpful. Our room was fairly basic but nice and clean. We had a pretty good lunch at the Fox Grill which is attached to the hotel. My only complaint would be the incredibly expensive wi-fi service. Overall we had a nice stay here and would return.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Convenient Location

reviews.text: We get to San Diego a couple of times each year and thought we'd try the Hilton Bay front, which turned out to be a great experience. It's new, the rooms are decent sized and typical for this class of Hilton, and they can provide a terrific view of the harbor/waterfront. The check-in/out service was excellent. Parking was expensive, as is the norm for hotels in this part of San Diego, but self-parking was fairly convenient and less costly than valet parking. My wife was presenting at a conference, which was taking place next door at the Convention Center, so convenience was a definite plus. This hotel is next to Petco Field (Padres home), and close to the Gas lamp district, with it's restaurants and other diversions. It's also on the Harbor, which provides access to some really nice walking/running and great people watching. Lots of 'touristy' shops and restaurants in the nearby Harbor Village, which you can get to via a nice walk along the waterfront (lots of boats docked there, etc.). We'll be staying here again when we return to San Diego this October.
reviews.title: Excellent Hilton right near Gaslamp District and Petco Park

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront for 3 nights over 4th of July weekend. Two episodes in the hotel lobby set the whole tone for me.
reviews.title: I was wowed

reviews.text: First, the desk clerk was happy to see us. Not because it was in her script. And not with a paste-on-smile. She sincerely enjoyed her work, and wanted to make sure that we enjoyed our stay. ( I wish I could remember her name, but her badge said she was from Ohio) A few feet away, they had a kid's check-in. 2 hotel staff, both with polo shirts rather than blazers and ties, were giving the kids grab bags and talking up the weekend. The kids in the elevator couldn't wait to show us their new sunglasses, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent for convention centre and gaslamp quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a big hotel, located next door to the convention center. But, they make a big hotel feel personal, not corporate. I was wowed.
reviews.title: Great View, Standard Amenities, Mediocre Service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only shortcoming: the parking ramp is not well marked. We moved the car 2x each day, and had trouble remembering where we parked. The hotel doesn't own the lot, so I can't fault them...but even putting A, B, C on the posts would allow us to remember where on the 3rd floor we left the car.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel with perfect location

reviews.text: Stayed for a conference in the convention centre.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but better for business than a vacation

reviews.text: Conveniently located next to Petco Park and a leisurely walk to shopping at Seaport Village, but otherwise not very memorable. It was okay, but for the same price there are much nicer places to stay when in San Diego. Room was clean and comfortable. There is a Starbucks but you have to go outside of the building near the bus drop off and round the corner. Not a bad place for a conference, but would not stay here for any personal travel.
reviews.title: Stayed here for a conference

reviews.text: I stayed for one week in this hotel attending a conference. The venue was perfect. It is also very conveniently located just across the gaslight district. The room had a great view on the harbour and bay. On the ground floor many types of restaurants are available. It is also not far to the seaport village. So far I always stayed in La Jolla, but this is a great location too.
reviews.title: Fantastic conference venue

reviews.text: Stayed as part of a conference. I thought for a hotel of this size things might have been a bit impersonal but was happily surprised. Staff were overall friendly and thoughtful. Conference deal included the port/bridge view room that are a bit cheaper than the bay view room. View was still nice out over the mountains and the sunrises were pretty. Room was as you'd expect for Hilton - good layout. Plenty of power outlets, iron and board standard, small safe. Like most hotels in the USA - no mini-bar. Ice bucket and dispenser down the hall. Bathroom was large and clean - shower only (no bath). A walk over the pedestrian bridge gets you into the Gaslight quarter. Lots of good places to eat. If you don't want to go that far then there's a couple of restaurants in the complex. Like most large hotels, expect to pay through the nose for Internet access in your room (although there's timebombed free WiFi in public lower floors).
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: This hotel was very clean, comfortable and up to date which I enjoyed. I never did realize there was a starbucks onsite due to the lack of signage. However, the view from the hotel both in my room and in the public areas was stunning! You also have an easy walk to the gaslamp district as well. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel In A Nice Location

reviews.text: I recently also attended a conference. I thought the view and the accomodations were beautiful. The Staff at the front desk recognized I was not feeling well, and although very early in the am, kindly checked in me to the room she had available. What a simple kindness that meant the world... I called the manager to point out this young lady who identified herself as TC. Very competant and kind.
reviews.title: Outstanding customer service

reviews.text: I normally book flights and hotels on hipmunk.com due to great convenience (flights first, then hotels some time later), but this time I flew on Southwest and used their package booking feature. Hotel was clean and comfortable. My meeting was held entirely within the hotel including breakfast and lunch meals and it was all very good. For dinners, a short walk to the gaslamp district was convenient. Only negatives were: (1) The onsite Starbucks is difficult to find with little signage to guide you. (2) The hotel was planning to eject me after 2 nights so I was locked out of my room. After showing my Southwest paperwork for 3 nights (which I had to recover from my room with their security guard), they got their act together at the front desk and allowed me to stay - however over an hour was wasted resolving this mess. They apologized but I am not sure why this happened in the first place.
reviews.title: Conference Stay

reviews.text: Went here for a conference. It was great for the business trip, but I wouldn't pay to stay here out of my own pocket. The view was pretty, and it's close to the convention center and down town. Walked down to searsucker (restaurant) and syrah wine parlor (bar). The bar was great, getting in is half the fun.
reviews.title: Business trip

reviews.text: This is a convention hotel that somewhat masquerades as a resort, so unless you are attending it for a conference expected to be dumbfounded by the price of food and beverages. I paid the extra $20.00 a night for a room with a view of the Bay, but many folks in the group didn't pay and got the same view, so consider that when they ask. For the record, I've stayed in Marriotts where the better views went without fee to Marriott Rewards higher status customers. On a related note, make sure you register for Hilton Honors before check-in, as the check-in lines (especially on weekends) are outrageous and the HH line moves a bit more quickly. The place was clean, and it's a reasonably short walk to the Gaslamp tourist trap; follow the sidewalk across the street to the Convention Center, walk along the front of the Center to Fifth Street and turn right. I suspect the place is short-handed, as the staff was reasonably friendly but frequently busy with other customers. This is not a place I would stay if I had to pay for it.
reviews.title: Place is Nice, But Not the Price

reviews.text: The hotel in general and staff were great. The views from our bedroom (28th floor) were stunning. My only complaint is the room was just an average room. One sink in a fairly small bathroom. If the hotel location, helpfulness and general facilities are what you are looking for this is it. The room (other than the amazing views) was just okay..nothing special. I have to admit though I spent a lot of time looking out the window with the amazing view of the water and of the Gaslamp District. I think a four star should have a larger room, with a bigger bathroom. The room on its own could be a three star, The hotel is a four star because of everything except the room..Great location, great staff, and nice areas all around.
reviews.title: The view and hotel location was great

reviews.text: I recently stayed here for a convention. This place has easy access to all sorts of fun places. It is easy to walk to the Gaslamp Quarter for a very nice dinner. You can also take a very nice walk along the water on the boardwalk. It is a short and easy walk to Seaport Village. Finally, this is right next to the convention center and is very convenient if you are attending a conference or event there. The hotel is nice and the rooms comfortable. My window looked out over the bay and was very nice at night for relaxation. It is a bit pricey, but that is what you get in venues such as this.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay. Easy access to area.
great location on the Bay
reviews.text: Ideally situated next to Convention Center and close to Gaslamp District (with many shops and restaurants). Starbucks located on ground level of Hilton, but you have to access from outside hotel. Use free wifi in Starbucks, or ask for wifi promotion code for access through HHonors if you are dining in Vela restaurant. Otherwise, wifi is pricey. Paid $20 extra per night for a room upgrade with Bay view; on 30th floor; awesome view. Self-park in deck attached to hotel at a rate of $27 per day. For evening relaxation, there is a nice fire pit located next to Fox Sports Grill; get drinks from Fox Sports Grill or Vela.

reviews.title: Well located, friendly and modern business hotel
reviews.text: Just around the corner from the San Diego convention center, the Hilton is in a great location for most business travel and downtown SD in general.

reviews.title: Pleased with our stay
reviews.text: Everything on my stay felt like "Hilton new" with a great bed, plasma tv, well sized room, clean, good.

reviews.title: Great location - beautiful view
reviews.text: Like most hiltons you'll pay for parking, wifi, and food isn't cheap but it's par for the course and well within polite rules for the expense reports if you're on business.

reviews.title: Eh....
reviews.text: Back to location... You'll find the water Just outside but good beaches require a little drive out of downtown. San Diego is a waking town so plan to spend 5 minutes getting to gas lamp or any food outside of the hotel property... But that's ok, it's a nice walk.

reviews.title: Easily one of the best in San Diego!
reviews.text: Great property - clean, modern and warm. Great location on the bay with super views and easy access. Our room was comfortable and well appointed - great bathroom and comfortable bed. The location gives you easy walking to Petco Park, Gaslamp, Seaport Village and the Convention Center. The hotel itself has nice amenities and easy parking access. What we liked best is the location and the modern design and amenitiies - it feels elegant and is modern clean while still being very warm and welcoming. Love the Odysea lounge and the selection of SD area microbrews on draft! What we liked least: service. Although all the people we interacted with were pleasant, the service itself was lacking. Let me give you two examples - when we checked in, we had to remind the front desk staff that we had booked a special package through Hilton. This was after they completed the check in process - we had to remind them of our package the benefits. We encountered the same problem on checkout - I had to remind the staff of our package - they just gave us the standard check out which didn't account for our resort credit and parking. Perhaps a minor detail, but why does the customer have to make sure they get the right rate and benefits when they have already been booked/confirmed? Lastly, the wait staff in the Odysea on our first visit were a bit slow and didn't even mention the specials including the Happy Hour (HH) specials (which we had no idea about). On our second & third visit the service was much improved but again, no mention of the HH specials (which include both early evening and late evening). At least by this time we knew of the early specials but we missed out on the late specials. Overall, I have stayed in tons of SD area hotes and this is simply the best I've ever encounted. Despite the minor service issues, I'd give this my strongest recommendation.

reviews.title: Nice property but odd internal traffic pattern
reviews.text: Nice property but with flaws. Why is there no Concierge Lounge? Why must you go outside and way around to get to the in-house Starbucks? Internal signage is unclear.

reviews.title: Breakfast service is poor
reviews.text: The Bayfront us located on the dock near the convention center. Vert nice hotel, elevators work beautifully, rooms/bathrooms are nice. The pool is functional, but the view from the pool is basically an old rusted Dole ship, but we kne thy coming in. My biggest complaint was Sunday breakfast, party of 6, Fathers day, my wife wanted to sit outside. Big mistake, service outside was not very good. We ordered the breakfast sandwiches and it took 45 minutes.

reviews.title: Lovely staff
reviews.text: I came to attend a conference and everything was well done. The hotel was clean, bright, the staff was amazing. Everyone, from the concierge to the folks who cleaned the room were cheerful, energetic, and seemed to be having a good time working together. I have attended many conferences and this was nearly seamless. (Small mix up at lunch, but not a big deal.) I would come back. Location was terrific and the room was not cheap, but I felt I got the value for the money. I wish I had more time here to enjoy the harbor walk located just outside the hotel.

reviews.title: Hilton trying to get every dollar possible.
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at Hilton SD Bayfront June 2011. The room was large the beds were comfortable and the bathrooms a good size. However, parking is $36 a night. And they charge $7 an hour for WIFI. Overall we liked our stay here but wouldn't come back because of the extra unnecessary charges.

description: Step in. From the moment you arrive you instantly feel the difference. All of the vitalizing elements of the sea and sun are embraced on this spectacular waterfront setting. Rising 30 stories above San Diego Bay, the Hilton San Diego Bayfront hotel is a spirited blend of San Diego’s coastal influences, style, innovation and of course the unmistakable vibe. Steps from downtown’s Gaslamp Quarter, San Diego Convention Center, and PETCO Park, this beautiful hotel offers the amenities and lays the best of the city at your doorstep. Now guests have easy access from the hotel by way of the pedestrian bridge, directly to PETCO Park, downtown’s vibrant Gaslamp district, and up-in-coming East Village. Luxury and comfort have no boundaries here. Enjoy magnificent San Diego Bay and city views from our lobby, restaurants and guest rooms. Each one of the 1,190 spacious guest rooms including 30 suites at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront has a Bay view and features Hilton's Serenity Collection® bed and linens, the finest amenities such as Peter Thomas Roth® products, and the latest technology. And true to Hilton tradition, exceptional service comes as effortlessly here as the tides ebb and flow. For a San Diego business trip, family weekend, or a romantic getaway, Hilton San Diego Bayfront accommodations offer something for everyone.
